instructions:
# **AD&D 1e Revised Sheet**

The **AD&D 1e Revised Sheet** includes all of the basic stats from the existing **AD&D 1st Edition Sheet** on Roll20 and should also be compatible with other OSR-style systems such as **OSRIC**. The **AD&D 1e Revised Sheet** may continue to change as needed/requested by the Roll20 community.

**NOTE:** Updating an older/existing AD&D 1st Edition Sheet character(ie pre-2024) with the AD&D 1e Revised Sheet should automatically migrate most attributes. That said, there are some sheet changes, newer attributes, and features that may require minimal, manual editing/updating in order to get full sheet functionality. I highly suggest testing the AD&D 1e Revised Sheet template on a copy of any existing AD&D 1st Edition Sheet game to see how the migration may effect your game. Simply change the character sheet template in the game settings page to use **'Advanced Dungeons and Dragons 1e'**.

## **Sheet Highlights:**
 - Sheet roll buttons for Ability-based skills, Saves, Thief Skills, Attacks, Spells, Special Abilities, and more.
 - Repeatable Weapons, Equipment, Spells, Special Abilities, Non Weapon Proficiencies.
 - Subcategories for Equipment.
 - Armor Details section that is linked to Equipment|Armor 
 - Hover over fields and buttons to view the associated attributes name and descriptive text.
 - Roll templates for Attacks, &{template:attacks} and a General &{template:general} for custom macro {key}={value}
 - Monster sheet statblock

#### **Sheet Auto-Calculations:**
 - Ability row attributes auto-fill according to the PHB.
 - Hit Points and AC.
 - Saves and Thief Skills
 - Total Armor bulk, Encumbrance, and Movement
 - Encumbrance and costs for Equipment, Armor, Weapons, and Coins.

#### **Sheet Options:**
 - to-Hit Matrix or THAC0 table whispered to the DM when using the attack button.
 - Background Options (parchment, goldenrod, moldvay, etc.).
 - Hide/Show various sections of the sheet as desired. 
 - Nearly all sheet macros are customizable. Attacks, Surprise, Initiative

Please post suggestions/questions/comments to the Roll20 Character Forum;
https://app.roll20.net/forum/category/277980

This is a persistent setting. Let the sheet auto-calculate AC based on the values entered in the Armor Details table above. This will overwrite all values in the bottom row. This can still be enabled/edited per sheet.

Let the sheet calculate Movement/Speed. Uses base movement and the current encumbrance(STR vs total_weight carried). Note: Load can can be set manually but any changes to base movement, encumbrance, or opening the sheet will trigger a re-calc. This can still be enabled/edited per sheet.

Let the sheet auto-fill the to-Hit tables when the class and level selectors are changed in the attack Matrix/THAC0 window. NOTE: The Autofill Table option uses the 1e table data to establish base THAC0, but it does not use the repeating 20's. This can still be enabled/edited per sheet.

Linking to a class will automatically adjust the to-Hit values when the linked class level changes. Note: multi-class/dual-class characters should pick the most favorable class. Defaults to Class 1 of 3 if enabled. This can still be enabled/edited per sheet.
Let the sheet auto-fill the Base chance when the level selector is changed. This can still be enabled/edited per sheet.
Linking to a class will automatically adjust the thief base  values when the linked class level changes. This can still be enabled/edited per sheet.
